Posts.Content: Lots of activity today but its good to hear from everyone! I went to my appointment to be told its now a grade 3 -Im in a 'grey area' grade 3 aggressive but no lymph node involvement Has anyone else had a grade three and not had chemo? Im planned for it strating 27th Sept Someone said they like positive stories well my sister had breast cancer when she was 27 years old had radical mastectomy - shes now 56 yrs! which is great xx love to all xxxx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed - very scared and emotional

Posts.Content: Here even! not hear -think its affected my brain!
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed - very scared and emotional

Posts.Content: Hi gill sorry your hear If you have a look at some of the stories you will see how differently we all react, I havent had one weepy day eother- Id rather not have it but I have so will have to get on with it. I feel guilty about  work too and have even answered my work emails! Im going to the appointment this afternoon to find out the plan for me! Ive had wide excision lumpectomy and sentinelle node biopsy. Have you got someone you know you can talk to - it does help. Keep in touch I hope the surgery goes okxxx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed - very scared and emotional

Posts.Content: Hi gill sorry your here If you have a look at some of the stories you will see how differently we all react, I havent had one weepy day eother- Id rather not have it but I have so will have to get on with it. I feel guilty about  work too and have even answered my work emails! Im going to the appointment this afternoon to find out the plan for me! Ive had wide excision lumpectomy and sentinelle node biopsy. Have you got someone you know you can talk to - it does help. Keep in touch I hope the surgery goes okxxx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed - very scared and emotional

Posts.Content: Hi Rachel my sister had breast cancer at 27 and then a mastectomy at 28 shes 56 now so shes done well. Ive just been diagnosed myself and underwent wide excision and sentinel node biopsies yesterday. Im a bit sore and have a huge pressure dressing over the top, I got away without needing a drain It wasnt as bad as I thought - try not to worry too much but thats easier said than done Hope it goes wel for you let me know how you get onxxx Dianne J
Posts.Title: Approaching Op

Posts.Content: Thanks for the info Im not worried about radiotherapy Im just feeling around for the possibility of me having to have chemotherapy- It seems a bit unclear over the criteria for requiring chemo- I know no one can tell me until they get the results from my operation on monday but I am looking for similarities in order to prepare myself if you know what I mean. Is anyone taking anastrazole and finding that its totally wrecked their sleep pattern? and makes them soooooo nauseous? I just want Monday to come now to get rid of this alien growing in my chest!!!! love to all xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Surgery results tomorrow

Posts.Content: Im a bit confused  can anyone enlighten me -I'm waiting for a wide excision lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy Im told the core biopsy provided evidence that my tumour was agrade 2 and is hormone sensitive and Ive started on anastazole -I will definetly have radiotherapy but may have chemotherapy -Has anyone else had just radiotherapy? just preparing myself! the wait is terribe. I havent updated my profile and I first came on the Mac site after my daughter was diagnosed with a grade three brain tumour but now Ive got cancer myself. Also did anyone carry on working through radiotherapy ? Sending good wishes to you all x
Posts.Title: Surgery results tomorrow

Posts.Content: That does seem a long time! did you have any problems such as haematomas as that can delay things a little- Id ask why you had to wait so long, Im not having radiotherapy until after chemo which starts Tuesday. xxx
Posts.Title: waiting time for adjuvant treatment
